00022 Recognizer::Recognizer (const std::string &path) : texts_(std::vector<Text>(0)), statistics_(std::vector<Statistics>(0))
00023 {
00024     // Load image from disk
00025     std::vector<Magick::Image> images;
00026     Magick::readImages( &images, path );
00027     
00028     Magick::Image image = images[0];
00029     
00030     // Store the image dimensions
00031     width_  = image.columns();
00032     height_ = image.rows();
00033     
00034     // Load image into the internal vector
00035     loadImage(image);
00036 };

00058 void Recognizer::obtainText ()
00059 {
00060     obtainText(0, 0, height_, width_);
00061 };

00083 void Recognizer::obtainText (const unsigned int &x, const unsigned int &y, unsigned int &height, unsigned int &width)
00084 {
00085     // Test the upper left-most pixel X coordinate is inside the source image
00086     if ( (x >= height_) or (x < 0) )
00087         throw NessieException ("Recognizer::obtainText() : The x coordinate of the clip's top left-most pixel is outside the image");
00088         
00089     // Test the upper left-most pixel Y coordinate is inside the source image
00090     if ( (y >= width_) or (y < 0) )
00091         throw NessieException ("Recognizer::obtainText() : The y coordinate of the clip's top left-most pixel is outside the image");
00092     
00093     // Test the clip's height is not bigger than the image
00094     if ( (height > height_) or (height < 0) )
00095         throw NessieException ("Recognizer::obtainText() : The height of the clip is bigger than the image's height or less than 0");
00096         
00097     // Test the clip's width is not bigger than the image
00098     if ( (width > width_) or (width < 0) )
00099         throw NessieException ("Recognizer::obtainText() : The width of the clip is bigger than the image's width or less than 0");
00100         
00101     // Truncate the clip's height if it is outside the source image
00102     if ((x + height) > height_)
00103         height = height_ - x;
00104     
00105     // Truncate the clip's width if it is outside the source image
00106     if ((y + width) > width_)
00107         width = width_ - y;
00108     
00109     // Creates the clip
00110     Clip clip(image_, x, y, height, width);
00111     
00112     
00113     // Preprocessing stage
00114     Preprocessor preprocessor;
00115     preprocessor.computeOptimalThreshold(clip);
00116     preprocessor.removeIsolatedNoise(clip);
00117     updateImage(clip);
00118     
00119     
00120     // Segmentation stage
00121     
00122     
00123     // Classification stage
00124 };

00130 void Recognizer::writeExternalImage (Magick::Image &externalImage) const
00131 {
00132     unsigned int rows = height_, columns = width_;
00133     
00134     // Test if the image is empty to create a new one
00135     if ( (externalImage.rows() == 0) and (externalImage.columns() == 0) )
00136         externalImage = Magick::Image(Magick::Geometry(width_, height_), "white");
00137     
00138     // Test if the external image fits into the current image
00139     if ( externalImage.rows() < height_ )
00140         rows = externalImage.rows();
00141     
00142     if ( externalImage.columns() < width_ )
00143         columns = externalImage.columns();
00144     
00145     // Convert the image into a grayscale colorspace
00146     externalImage.type( Magick::GrayscaleType );
00147     
00148     // Ensure that there is only one reference to underlying image
00149     // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.
00150     externalImage.modifyImage();
00151         
00152     // Copy the current data into the external image
00153     for ( unsigned int i = 0; i < rows; ++i )
00154     {
00155         for ( unsigned int j = 0; j < columns; ++j )
00156         {
00157             unsigned int index = (i * columns) + j;
00158             
00159             Magick::ColorGray color;
00160             color.shade(static_cast<double>(image_[index]) / 255.0);
00161             externalImage.pixelColor(j, i, color);
00162         }
00163     }
00164     
00165     // Save changes to image.
00166     externalImage.syncPixels();
00167 };

00174 void Recognizer::loadImage (Magick::Image &image)
00175 {
00176     // Convert the image into grayscale colorspace
00177     image.type( Magick::GrayscaleType );
00178     
00179     // Ensure that there is only one reference to underlying image
00180     // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.
00181     image.modifyImage();
00182     
00183     // Copy the image into the internal data structure
00184     image_.reserve(height_ * width_);
00185     for ( unsigned int i = 0; i < height_; ++i )
00186     {
00187         for ( unsigned int j = 0; j < width_; ++j )
00188         {
00189             Magick::ColorGray grayLevel = image.pixelColor(j, i);
00190             
00191             image_.push_back( static_cast<unsigned char>(round(grayLevel.shade() * 255.0)) );
00192         }
00193     }   
00194 };

00196 
00201 void Recognizer::updateImage (const Clip &clip)
00202 {
00203     unsigned int p = 0, q;
00204     for ( unsigned int i = clip.x(); i < clip.height(); ++i )
00205     {
00206         q = 0;
00207         for ( unsigned int j = clip.y(); j < clip.width(); ++j )
00208         {
00209             image_[(i * width_) + j] = clip.getPixelGrayLevel(p, q++);
00210         }
00211         p++;
00212     }
00213 };
